general_advisory: Keep the harvested paddy and non-paddy crops in a safe and waterproof place to avoid rainfall and high wind speeds. Go for plucking of flowers to avoid deterioration of flower quality. Make strong wooden support for papaya and banana plants to avoid lodging. Harvest the mature vegetables and make strong support for trailing type vegetables. Avoid spraying pesticides during this period. Don't let domestic animals outside during this period; make provision of fodder and clean drinking water for 2-3 days. Don't tie cattle under trees or near any big trees.

advisory: Make a path at an interval of 10 feet for better drainage of rainwater.
Spray 2% salt solution (20 gm salt in 1 litre water) in places where the harvesting of matured rice grain is not possible to prevent the germination of rice grain.
When there is 80-85% ripening in rice grain in the panicle, harvest the crops and store them in a safe place.
Safely place the harvested grain from the rice field.
Harvested straw should be kept in a proper way.
Take necessary action to protect the rice grain in the godown (mandi) from rain.
Make provision for drainage in pulses (Pigeon pea, green gram, black gram).
Spray 1.5% chloropyriphos or 0.4% Fenovalarate into the ridges to check the spreading of black-headed caterpillar pest to other fields in pulses crop.

In green gram/black gram, there are chances of infestation of leaf-eating caterpillar and black-headed caterpillar. To control from this, spray a mixture of 2ml profenophos 50%EC or 2 ml quinalphos 25%EC or 1 ml dichlorvos 76%EC per liter of water @200 liters per acre during the afternoon.
Spray 2ml dimethoate 30%EC or 0.3 ml imidacloprid 17.8%SL per liter of water @ 200 liters mixture per acre in case of aphid pest infestation in black gram/green gram.

In green gram/black gram, there are chances of infestation of wilting due to footrot. To control this, spray the fungicide 2gm carbendazim 12% + mancozeb 63%WP or 2gm metalaxyl 8% + mancozeb 64%WP per liter of water @200 liters mixture per acre at the base of the plants.

Spray the mixture of fungicides 1ml phenoxol 10%EC or 1 ml propiconazole 25%EC or 1 ml tebuconazole 25.9%EC or 4 gm sulphur 80%WP per liter of water @200 liters per acre to control from powdery mildew.
When there is infestation of Yellow mosaic virus, spray the mixture of 2ml dimethoate 30%EC or 0.3 gm acetamiprid 20%SP per liter of water @200 liters per acre to check its vector i.e white fly.
Make provision for drainage.
If seedlings of brinjal or tomato set topple by means of rain, straighten them by staking and earthing up.
Spray 1.5gm Streptocycline + 3gm Copper oxychloride per liter water to the root zone for wilting in brinjal and tomato, 200 liters mixture required for one acre.
Spray 2gm Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63%WP per liter water for fruit rot in brinjal, 200 liters mixture required for one acre.
Make provision for drainage.
If seedlings of brinjal or tomato set topple by means of rain straight them by staking and earthing up.
Spray 1.5gm Streptocycline + 3gm Copper oxychloride per liter water to the root zone for wilting in brinjal and tomato, 200 liters mixture required for one acre.
Spray 2gm Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63%WP per liter water for fruit rot in brinjal, 200 liters mixture required for one acre.
Make provision for drainage.
Spray 0.4 ml Flubendiamide 39.35%SC/lit, there is a requirement of 200 liters insecticide for the attack of hairy caterpillar.
If cercospora leaf spot is seen then spray 1ml Difenoconazole 25%EC or 2gm Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63%WP (2gm)/1 liter water. 200 liters mixture is required to spray 1 acre.
Make provision for drainage.
Spray 2 ml Fenpyroximate 5%EC or 2 ml Propargite 57%EC per liter of water to control the infestation of mites attack.
To control from top rot and black spot disease spray 3 gm Copper oxychloride 50% WP per liter of water.
Spray the mixtures of 1ml Penconazol 10%EC or 1ml propiconazol 25%EC or 1 gm Tebuconazol 25.9%EC or 4 gm Sulphur 80%WP @ 200 liters water for control from powdery mildew.
Make provision for drainage.
To control from sigatoka leaf spot spray 2 gm Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63%WP or Chlorothalonil 75%WP per liter of water.
Make provision for drainage.
Spray 0.3 ml Imidacloprid 17.8%SL or 0.3 gm Thiomethoxam 25%WG per liter of water to prevent from mealy bug and Aphid.
To control from the infestation of red palm weevil apply Carbendazim 3%G + Sand 1:1 ratio in the hole of the stem and plug the hole.
To control from Rhinoceros beetle clean the nearby compost yard of the coconut garden and disinfect it by applying 1.5% Chloropyriphos dust.
Adequate drainage facilities in the nursery beds should be provided.
When it is raining, cover the nursery bed with white polythene film, avoid black polythene cover as the seedlings grow tall under it.
If seed sowing is not done then sow the seeds after seed treatment and by measuring appropriate soil moisture.
Apply 2gm Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% or 1gm Captan 70% + Hexaconazole 5%WP / 1 liter water after rain for collar rot in seedlings.
